sentence.Network_en: The fires are likely to permanently deforest the land.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些火灾很可能会彻底毁掉这片土地上的森林。

sentence.Network_en: His reason had been permanently affected by what he had witnessed.
sentence.Network_cn: 他所目睹的那一幕永久性地影响了他的神智。

sentence.Network_en: The individual's whole personality appears to be permanently warped.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个人的整个人格似乎被永远地扭曲了。

entry.def: Something that is permanent lasts for ever.

example.ex: Heavy drinking can cause permanent damage to the brain...
example.tran: 酗酒能造成永久性大脑损伤。
该问题一劳永逸的解决办法

entry.tran: （尤指问题或困难）不断出现的，一直存在的
entry.def: You use permanent to describe situations or states that keep occurring or which seem to exist all the time; used especially to describe problems or difficulties.

example.tran: 他们觉得一直处于威胁之下。

entry.def: A permanent employee is one who is employed for an unlimited length of time.

example.ex: At the end of the probationary period you will become a permanent employee.
example.tran: 试用期结束后,你将成为长期雇员。

entry.def: Your permanent home or your permanent address is the one at which you spend most of your time or the one that you return to after having stayed in other places.

example.ex: York Cottage was as near to a permanent home as the children knew...
example.tran: 在孩子们眼中,约克小屋最像一个安定的家。

entry.def: A permanent is a treatment where a hair stylist curls your hair and treats it with a chemical so that it stays curly for several months.

means.word_mean: 1. for a long time without essential change;

auth_sentence.content: Some critics say the plant should be permanently shuttered.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some critics say the plant should be permanently shuttered.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some critics say the plant should be permanently shuttered.

auth_sentence.content: He suggested the vice be left in place permanently .

Sentence.sentence: Within the wider business world, a man who liked to see himself as a hippy （嬉皮士）, permanently in revolt against big companies, ended up being hailed by many of those corporate giants as one of the greatest chief executives of his time.
However, although eyestrain may cause some pain or headaches, it does not permanently damage eyesight.
It can permanently change the eye structure
Educators may fear that children hearing two languages will become permanently confused and thus their language development will be delayed ;this concern is not documented in the literature.
The recession permanently wiped out 2.5 million jobs.

sentences.en: His radio is permanently tuned to Radio 1.
sentences.cn: 他的收音机永远调拨在无线电1 台上。

sentences.en: Male workers were made permanently sterile by this pesticide.
sentences.cn: 这种杀虫剂使得男性工人终生不育。

sentences.en: The accident left him permanently scarred.
sentences.cn: 那次事故给他留下了永久的伤疤。

sentences.en: The ship is now permanently moored on the Thames in London.
sentences.cn: 该船现在永久地停泊在伦敦泰晤士河边。
